SENT.plain: Follicular lymphomas (FL) are among the most common non-Hodgkin's lymphoma (NHL) in adults
However, they are rare in children making up less than 3% of paediatric NHL cases
They occur most commonly in the head and neck region, lymph nodes or tonsils, with occasional extra-nodal occurrences
Distinction of FL from potentially clonal but, reactive follicular hyperplasia is important
We report a case of a 6-year-old male child presenting with night stridor since 6 months
Clinical examination revealed asymmetrical enlargement of the left tonsil
Routine left tonsillectomy was performed and the specimen was sent for histopathological examination
Diagnosis of follicular lymphoma was made on histopathological examination and further confirmed by immunohistochemistry
